Leather and suede dresses can be worn during warmer weather, but it depends on a few factors, such as the fabric weight, the dress style, and the climate of the location. 

If you live in a hot and humid climate, you may want to opt for leather or suede dresses that are lightweight and breathable. Some examples of lightweight leather or suede dresses include shift dresses, shirt dresses, or midi dresses with slits. These dress styles allow for air circulation and can keep you cool and comfortable in warmer weather. 

When it comes to dress styles, leather or suede mini dresses, sleeveless dresses, or dresses with spaghetti straps can be suitable for warm weather. These styles can allow for more skin exposure and ventilation.

However, leather or suede dresses might not be as comfortable when the temperature rises above a certain point. In general, they are considered more appropriate for cooler seasons, such as fall and winter, when the weather is cooler but not freezing.

Ultimately, wearing leather or suede dresses in warmer weather can be done, but it requires careful consideration of the fabric weight, style, and climate.
